meta.title: Visa Information for Thai Students in Korea
meta.subtitle: ข้อมูลวีซ่าสำหรับนักเรียนไทยในสาธารณรัฐเกาหลี
meta.description: This page is prepared as a guide and preliminary information source for Thai students who wish to study, live, and reside in South Korea. The Thai Students Association in the Republic of Korea (TSAK) has compiled visa information specifically for students to help ensure preparation is accurate and smooth.

d2.title: 1.1 D-2 Visa: Higher Education Student Visa

documents.label: Required Documents (General)
items: Certificate of Admission from Korean university

costs.label: Estimated Costs
items: ARC (Alien Registration Card) fee: approximately 35,000 KRW

benefits.label: Key Benefits
items: Long-term stay according to study period
Can apply for part-time work permit according to Immigration Office conditions

notes.label: Important Notes
items: Part-time work is more restricted than D-2 visa
Must complete required study hours as specified

d10.title: 2.1 D-10 Visa: Job Seeker Visa
d10.suitableFor: Suitable for: Students who graduated from Korean institutions and want to find employment
details: Valid for up to 6 months (extendable under certain conditions)
Must show proof of graduation from Korean institution
Must have a clear job search plan

e7.title: 2.2 E-7 Visa: Professional Work Visa
details: Those employed in positions requiring specialized skills
Can be extended from D-2 or D-10

arc.title: 3. Alien Registration Card (ARC)
arc.description: All foreign students staying over 90 days must register for ARC

partTimeWork.title: 4. Part-time Work for Students
requirements: Must obtain permission from Immigration Office
Working hours limited according to study level
Must meet required academic performance standards

warnings.title: 5. Important Warnings
items: Must report address change within 14 days
Must renew visa before expiration date

items.name: TSAK – Thai Students Association in the Republic of Korea

disclaimer.label: Note
disclaimer.text: Information on this page is prepared as a preliminary guide. It may change according to Korean government policies. Visa applicants should verify the latest information from official agencies before proceeding.
